section.title: Testing And Debugging YCP-Code
section.para: In a programmers daily life errors are unavoidable (alas). Therefore there must be some means to track down errors quickly. ≶ provides two methods for finding errors in the code as well as logging specific events in the program flow. The following links deal with hunting bugs in ≶ code.

listitem.para: In the previous sections there were repeatedly references to the logfile that is written during a &prog; session. Because we were only interested in the output we wanted to produce with the ≶ examples, the details associated with logging were left out there. However, since the logging mechanism implied by &prog; is rather powerful there shall be some additional explanations regarding this topic. To make use of the various features related to logging, you should read the following developers documentation.

For checking errors in a ≶ program during runtime there is a debugger available. Since the respective package is not part of the standard installation, it has to be installed manually: yast2-debugger. Its usage is explained in the developers ducumentation. Please follow the link below.
